Name: Wooden coffin for a shrew
Description: The trapezoid coffin is made of cedar wood. The lid is flat and attached to each of the longer sides by two dowels. The painted decoration, on a white background, is very well preserved. The sidewalls are bordered at the top and sides by a blue-red triglyphic band, the lid is bordered by a red stripe. A shrew is depicted on each of the long sides, on the rear short end is a hovering falcon with a double feather on its head and ostrich feathers in its claws. The front short end depicts a standing deity.
